ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Writing an ethnography, technological systems, so much about the modern state of technology and how it affects our world

This class taught me how to look at the intersection of society/culture and technology beyond the superficial observations; recognising how deeply intertwined the two are with each other. It gave me a lens to analyze technology through, forcing me to observe things that I otherwise would not think of.
The insights into our tech-filled (and honestly tech-oriented) culture were eye-opening. I find myself absorbing a lot of what I view online with a more critical lens naturally.
I learned so much about the field of anthropology in this class was absolutely fascinating. I particularly like learning about AI.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This class is amazing! Readings are always super relevant and Prof. Messeri facilitates such good class discussion that the seminar never feels boring and flies by.

The course was really well taught and Prof. Messeri was super understanding and engaging, making all classes fun to attend. She also tried different styles of going about the class topics which was very unique. The topics of the class itself were unique and very relevant to real life. The digital ethnography project at the end was super fun and interesting to undertake as well.

The grading was unexpectedly harsh and didn't feel entirely fair at times. I feel that the feedback of what I was doing wrong was sometimes unclear, or when I tried to respond to feeback on the next assignments (after meet with my TA to get a better sense), it still wasn't good enough to improve the grade. 

I enjoyed the discussions a lot.

The course structure and small size of the class were very high strengths. We were able to get a lot of discussion going given how tech-involved society already is. There was always a lot to talk about!! 

Weakness: I liked the last segment of choosing our digital communities, but I honestly enjoyed the broader tech journal entries the most. If the final paper could somehow orient itself towards the tech journals of the first half of the semester that would be a lot more engaging.

The strength of this class or that it is absolutely never boring. I am always invested in the readings and in class time. Sometimes I wasnt sure what exactly they were looking for with the papers, but overall I loved the class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Especially for CS majors. Its a great opportunity to learn about how the technology were creating is going to affect society.

I would definitely recommend this course! I feel like I learnt a lot from it and getting to know Prof. Messeri was amazing. This was my first course in anthropology (as a STEM major) and I felt very comfortable yet challenged (in a good way). The digital ethnography project at the end was definitely one of the most unique tasks I've undertaken at Yale, and I really enjoyed the class discussions every week. I feel like I got a lot out of it in terms of analyzing how technology impacts our society and culture and developing a more nuanced approach to these topics.
I would, if they feel passionate about learning about technology

YES! Coming from a senior, this was my favorite course at Yale. I didn't realize STS (Science and Technology Studies) was even an option for looking at how technology and society blend together and I'm glad this is a class students can take.
Yes, Ive already recommended it to 10 friends
